name: The Other 25 Fractured States Quiz | Geography - Wordplay | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
California.

	My home state, though I was born in Chilliwack, British Columbia, Canada.

Nebraska.

	Remember the Kansas-Nebraska Act?

Vermont.

	Wow, if you've never been there in October, you MUST go. I like your progressive politics, Vermonters.

Massachusetts.

	If you want some excellent clam chowder, go to Nantucket. During my brother-in-law's 25th reunion I stayed in a 200-plus-year-old dorm at Harvard. The Public Garden is the setting for "Make Way for Ducklings" by Robert McCloskey.

New Jersey.

	Birthplace of my good friend Amy Leibowitz.

Utah.

	There are some gorgeous rock formations there.

Alabama.

	In Birmingham there is a 60-ton statue of Vulcan, the Roman god of fire.

Georgia.

	Home of the Atlanta Olympics.

Kansas.

	A player from Kansas contributed this interesting info tidbit: Wyatt Earp and Bat Masterson both served as Wichita, Kansas sheriffs.

Washington.

	Home to many good friends and dear relations of mine. Hello to Chris and Jay, Gary, Chris and Noah, Cousin Nancy, Uncle Bill and Aunt Penny, Cousins Brian, Janet, and Alan, Cousins Kathy and Scott, Alan and Francesca, and Leslie, Stan's sister.

Minnesota.

	Home of the Twin Cities. I'm very sad about Senator Paul Wellstone's death. He was a true leader.

New Hampshire.

	Home of the craftswoman who taught me how to make braided rugs.

Nevada.

	Home of Lost Wages.

Ohio.

	If you're ever in Cleveland, you can visit The Rock 'n' Roll Hall of Fame! Cincinnati is home to the Freedom Center that memorializes the Underground Railroad (thanks to Jennifer for that piece of info).

Oklahoma.

	You're OK by us.

Florida.

	Once I spent a lovely 6 weeks working in Orlando (during the early spring, so it wasn't too hot). They've got some BIG bugs there! I learned to do Western line dancing and I rode my bike all over this beautiful area. Orlando has a lot more to offer than theme parks.

questions.text: What state do you get if you cross the word 'mountain' with the word 'bandana'?
questions.explanation:
Montana.

	A beautiful, mountainous state.

Connecticut.

	In the 2001-2002 season, the University of Connecticut's (UCONN's) women's basketball team, the Huskies, won the NCAA Championship. During that season, the Huskies won all 39 games that they played! Once I worked in Madison, Connecticut, a lovely little town, for a couple of weeks. It was winter and COLD there, but I had a fireplace in my Bed and Breakfast bedroom.

Texas.

	Don't mess with Texas!

West Virginia.

	Player TAR_fan sent me the following interesting information tidbit: below the Greenbrier Resort near White Sulphur Springs is a formerly secret bunker that was designed to shelter the US Congress in case of war. It's no longer operational, and is open to the public for tours! Player AgentBristow06 informs me that "Alias" star Jennifer Garner was born in West Virginia.

Iowa.

	Wide-open spaces. Cornfields and prairies. Rolling hills. A player called Scholar25 wants you all to know that Lemars, Iowa, Home of the Blue Bunny, is the ice-cream capital of the world!

Idaho.

	Thanks, Idaho, for French fries, mashed potatoes, scalloped potatoes, Tater Tots, and so on. More spacious skies.

North Carolina.

	Once I went to an Israeli folkdance camp in Hendersonville. The soil IS red there! What a lovely green state!

South Dakota.

	A player named JB4492 informs me that the U.S. Presidents whose portraits appear on Mount Rushmore are Teddy Roosevelt, Abraham Lincoln, Thomas Jefferson, and George Washington.

Mississippi.

	This great state's name has 1 em, 2 peas, 4 eyes, and 4 esses.
